item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: A Romantic Reunion Walkthrough
item.description:
A Romantic Reunion is a hidden quest for Flynn Rider in Disney Dreamlight Valley . Upon meeting the rogue for the first time, he keeps talking about a girl but doesn’t want to meet her until he figures out his situation with the curse inflicted by Maleficent.

After curing the curse and publishing his book, Flynn feels ready to be with Rapunzel again, which is where players come in. You need to help him set up a romantic reunion so that the rogue can spend time with his lover.

How To Trigger A Romantic Reunion Quest In Disney Dreamlight Valley

To trigger A Romantic Reunion quest, players must complete Flynn Rider’s final friendship quest in Disney Dreamlight Valley , The Adventures of Flynn Rider, and Rapunzel’s quest as well, Home is Where the Art Is. Next, head to the mail near your house and claim Flynn’s adventures book from it to start A Romantic Reunion.

Locate Rapunzel and give her the book. She accepts it but appears a bit sad as Flynn seems to be avoiding her. Players then need to talk to Flynn and start planning a romantic reunion.

How To Complete A Romantic Reunion Quest In Disney Dreamlight Valley

The first thing you need to prepare is six meals for Rapunzel and Flynn in Disney Dreamlight Valley . Three must be from Eternity Isle and three from Storybook Vale. Here are some ideas for what to cook:

Recipe

Ingredients

Eternity Isle

Bulgur Salad

  • Wheat
  • Cucumber
  • Tomato
  • Mint
  • Any Spice

Coleslaw

  • Cabbage
  • Carrot

Dumplings

  • Any Meat
  • Wheat
  • Any Vegetable
  • Soya

Falafel

  • Beans
  • Cumin
  • Garlic

Storybook Vale

Ambrosia Smoothie

  • Plain Yogurt
  • Ambrosia

Greek Potatoes

  • Potato
  • Any Fruit
  • Garlic
  • Salt Crystal
  • Any Spice

Argossian Pizza

  • Elysian Grain
  • Onion
  • Any Vegetable
  • Flyleaf Feta
  • Olives

Cape Gooseberry Chia Pancakes

  • Wheat
  • Chia Seeds
  • Shovel Bird Eggs
  • Cape Gooseberry

Once the recipes are ready in Disney Dreamlight Valley , give them to Flynn and then start collecting materials to craft a Dinghy Boat for the couples.

  • Iron Ingot x2: Combine Iron Ore x5 and Coal Ore x1 to make Iron Ingot or buy it from Kristoff’s Stall if available.
  • Petrified Wood x18: Mine any rock spot in The Bind or Everafter.
  • Pine Cone x12: Pick it up from the ground in The Bind.
  • Common Club Rush x9: Pick it up from the ground in the Everafter.
  • Coal Ore x12: Mine any rock spot anywhere or buy it from Kristoff’s Stall if available.

Craft the Dinghy Boat and you can wait for nightfall to place it somewhere in Storybook Vale or do it immediately. A short cutscene will play showing Rapunzel and Flynn having a romantic moment. Next, head to the couple and listen to the conversation to complete A Romantic Reunion quest.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: The Adventures Of Flynn Rider (Flynn Rider’s Final Friendship Quest)
item.description:
The Adventures of Flynn Rider is the fourth and final friendship quest players can trigger in Disney Dreamlight Valley . The main requirement is that the rogue must be friendship level 10, which takes a lot of time.

What you can do to reach the required friendship level with any character easily is Disney Dreamlight Valley , is to gift them their favorite gifts every day. Also, hang out with them as much as possible and try activities that match their assigned role.

How To Complete The Adventures Of Flynn Rider In Disney Dreamlight Valley

The two main requirements for The Adventures of Flynn Rider quest are that you maximize Flynn’s friendship level and that Mount Olympus must be available, which costs 10,000 Storybook Magic. Keep in mind you can only reach the area by unlocking the others as well, which also costs around 10,000 Storybook Magic.

Upon triggering the quest in Disney Dreamlight Valley , Flynn says he would like to share his stories with others, but doesn’t know how. Players suggest finding a ghostwriter to write the book and the best option in this case is Belle. After Flynn talks with Belle, Dreamers need to take pictures with Flynn in three locations to advertise him for his upcoming book:

  • At Mount Olympus near the gates of Hades’ trial.
  • Anywhere in The Wild Woods .
  • At the fountain in The Bind , behind The Lorekeeper.

After taking the pictures, check the mail near your house to see if there are any business cards from potential publishers. There will be two; one from Scrooge McDuck and one from Goofy. Speak with Flynn to ask him for his opinion, but he simply prefers to self-publish instead.

With that in mind, you both agree to craft a Book Signing Table. Head to Scrooge’s store and buy the Ink and Feather Set for 1,500 Star Coins and then go out to collect the rest of the materials to craft the table:

  • Marble x10: Mine any rock spot in Mythopia.
  • Pine Cone x12: Collect from the ground near trees in The Bind.
  • Gravel x14: Dig the ground in Mythopia.
  • Petrified Wood x16: Mine any rock spot in Everafter and Mythopia.

Once all the materials are collected, craft the Book Signing Table and place it anywhere in Storybook Vale. Take pictures with the characters and then speak with Flynn.

He wants to give his stories to The Lorekeeper, so go with him and listen to the conversation. After that, he thanks you for helping him and gives the Legendary Rogue Outfit, which completes The Adventures of Flynn Rider quest.

item.title: The Witcher 3 Fan Makes Their Own Version of the Game, And It's Absolutely Hilarious
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Player-created funny version of The Witcher 3 entertains the fanbase.
  • The game's fanbase continues to engage with mods and creative content.
  • The Witcher 3's immersive world and strong fan support keeps it relevant.

Recently, a fan of The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt shared their own version of the game on a popular internet forum, which shows clunky game mechanics and purposely funny gameplay that had various internet users laughing. Over the years, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt has amassed a massive following, captivating both newcomers and longtime fans of the franchise and the books.

Despite turning 10-years-old in 2025, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt still has many secrets left for players to discover. Since its release, CD Projekt RED's title has been praised by many for its immersive world, extensive lore, amazing combat mechanics, and likable characters that mix together to deliver the ultimate fantasy RPG experience.

In a recent post, Redditor bay_lenin shared with the r/Witcher3 subreddit their own version of the game, showing Geralt of Rivia frozen in a T-pose as he tries to catch still images of Roach and Dandellion. This hilarious version of the game includes elements like a "Roach Boost," which, according to the poster, grants players an 8-second speed boost every time they catch Roach. The Redditor claimed that their mother had forbidden them from buying The Witcher 3 , which prompted them to make their own version. It's undeniable that bay_lenin's version of this title is objectively funny, and since The Witcher 3 now officially features mod support, many more interesting takes on the game are likely to come in the future.

The Witcher 3 Fan Creates Their Own Hilarious Version of the Game

The modding community is very strong across various popular games, and since mods officially became available in The Witcher 3 earlier this year, players have been on a creative streak. Recently, a NexusMods user by the name of AngryCatster released a mod for The Witcher 3 that adds maps from the first game, complementing the experience wonderfully.

Although bay_lenin's hilarious version of the game isn't a mod, but rather a funny joke to share with fans of the franchise, this level of engagement goes to show how devoted the title's fanbase is. And now, with the REDkit add-on tool released for The Witcher 3 , players can let their imagination and modding skills make of the game what they will.

The Witcher universe is one of the most complete and interesting to have ever been released in the last couple of decades. Even now, players keep discovering hidden cutscenes in The Witcher 3 , proving just how much attention to detail the developers put into the game. With no official release date for The Witcher 4 , all players can do while they wait is keep creating funny content around the game's universe and enjoy the contributions of others to have a laugh here and there.

item.title: Minecraft: 25 Best Magic Mods You Need To Try
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Magic mods in Minecraft offer expansive experiences beyond Vanilla, with unique items and mechanics to engage players in new ways.
  • Popular magic mods like Mahou Tsukai provide combat-oriented gameplay with diverse spells and mana mechanics for dynamic battles.
  • Botania offers a tech mod with magical elements, utilizing mana and natural resources to create a unique gameplay experience in Minecraft.

Minecraft is a game with almost limitless possibilities as, thanks to its sandbox environment, and with mods, it can be taken in any direction a player sees fit. Whether it's spicing up combat, soaring into the Industrial Revolution and into space, or diving into a world of magic and mystique, there is something out there for everyone.

With how far mods can now take things in Minecraft , it's hard to argue that many of them have a little magic sprinkled into the mix, but what are the best mods for diving into wizardry and wonder? Here are some Minecraft mods that are definitely worth the time investment, covering everything from spell casting to space-age sorcery.

Updated on December 2, 2024, by Amjad A. Asma: Magic mods in Minecraft showcase some of the best that the community has to offer. They stretch the sandbox survival game's limits, providing an experience that is far more expansive, focused, and different from what the Vanilla variant has to offer. The best Minecraft magic mods listed in this article offer a great set of items, gameplay experiences, world-building, and crafting mechanics. Since the mods present are expansive and have millions of downloads, new players are sure to find kinship among those who have already tried these out. The implementation level and user engagement also show that these have come a long way and are committed to player satisfaction. These are some of the best magic mods available for Minecraft, and many of them also support integration with those that bring in additional magical elements. As such, fans can often mix and match different creations to further customize their gameplay experience.

25 Malum

No. of Downloads: 2.7M

  • Creator: sammysemicolon
  • Download link: Malum

Malum is a popular magic mod for Minecraft , having been around for a good while now. It focuses on a niche aspect of magic - spirit arcana. Through this, players can engage in soul magic and shape the entire experience around them. They have access to a whole new list of underground ores, armor, functional items, and more, making exploration and experimentation a lot more rewarding. This helps keep the experience from becoming repetitive.

Aside from discovering new items, players can also create things from nothing by using spirit focusing. Creating new things, fusing them together, bringing miracles to life—these are but a few options open to players of this Minecraft magic mod. With so much going on, things can naturally get a bit confusing. To help with this, the creator has added an extensive codex that will help players understand what’s going on and what route to take. There are very few limits present, freeing fans up to do whatever they like.

24 Ars Magica 2

No. of Downloads: 4.6M

  • Creator: AWildCanadianEh
  • Download link: Ars Magica 2

For players looking for a more complete look at a magical Minecraft , Ars Magica 2 offers a much more rounded and filled-out experience. The mod covers just about everything, from casting powerful spells to fighting bosses or just having some fun with magic, with a ton of features on offer.

Without spoiling too much, this mod offers a fantastic system of progression. Players will find themselves with a ton of new items, armor, and weapons, and with a completely new way of interacting with the world. Ars Magica 2 is common in modpacks as players will find themselves on a real journey as they progress, but using it as a standalone won't detract from the experience at all.

Ars Magica 2 was last updated in May 2023 for Minecraft 1.10.2.

23 Feywild

No. of Downloads: 5.9M

  • Creator: saphienyako
  • Download link: Feywild

There are many magic mods that add sorcery elements and a bunch of important items, and maybe even biomes. Feywild is one of the top-tier Minecraft mods that add quests and various characters, essentially providing fans with a much more fulfilling experience. This magic mod for Minecraft also adds a whole new dimension with biomes based on the characters. These are Seasonal Courts with their own Fey, where players can choose to do their quests and be bound to them. Moreover, players who like elements from other Minecraft magic mods can access them via the Library in Feywild. This deepens the immersiveness to a fantastic degree.

​

There are also golem-like entities called Tree Ents present, each designed as per their Seasonal Court. Feywild, as with other Minecraft magic mods, brings in a lot of texture and visual changes, even if fans exclude the exhaustive list of new blocks. The quest-giving characters, the interactive mobs, items like the Summoning Scroll, and the magical biomes make Feywild one of the best offerings on this list. Simply put, these are but a few factors that make this magic mod for Minecraft a must-have. This is especially emphasized for those who grew up reading about the Fey and their fantasy lands.

22 Mana and Artifice

No. of Downloads: 7.8M

  • Creator: AWildCanadianEh
  • Download link: Mana and Artifice

Mana and Artifice comes from the same creator as Ars Magica 2, another top magic mod for Minecraft that players should try out. Termed as the “spiritual successor,” it elaborates and improves the many features that Ars Magica 2 brings to the table. As a result, there’s a lot that is available to players, ensuring they remain engaged no matter their personal requirements.

Mana and Artifice brings in ancient evils, gods, sorcerers, and more to interact and battle. Minecraft modders can create custom spells, devise rituals that cast strong magic, and explore a world that is filled with new structures. If this sounds too much to handle alone, there's help. Similar to games where players can command armies, they can create one here as well, and send them to do their bidding. Newcomers don’t need to worry either, as there are detailed guides in place to help them with progression.

21 Wizards (RPG Series)

No. of Downloads: 7.9M

  • Creator: daedelus_dev
  • Download link: Wizards (RPG Series)

Wizards (RPG Series) is a stellar mod for anyone who wants to become a sorcerer. This Minecraft magic mod adds a number of staves and wands for players to use, each with their niche spell school. Naturally, they each bring their own set of spells and status effects. The staves add more Spell Power but require more crafting ingredients, and it's thus a toss-up for players on what they want to go with.

This magic mod for Minecraft also adds a Wizard's Tower in each major biome, where their architectural design depends on their placement. Further, the Wizard NPC offers good magical trades. Gamers can also use the NPC's Spell Binding Table to add more spells to their wands or staves and even use the Crafting Altar to craft Runes at a better rate. However, the most important factor that makes Wizards (RPG Series) a great magic mod for Minecraft is that the developer has also created separate mods for Paladins, Archers, and other classes. They have also created a Dungeons Heroes (RPG Series) modpack with all the mods, even one for new dungeons and loot.

20 The Abyss II - The Other Side

No. of Downloads: 8.1M

  • Creator: y4z0n
  • Download link: The Abyss II - The Other Side

The Abyss II takes players just there - the other side. It presents an alternate dimension brimming with magic and wildlife, right there for the taking. However, doing so is easier said than done as there’s constant danger all around. The new dimension is dimly lit, making the experience feel visually immersive and alive but threatening.

The Abyss II Minecraft magic mod also adds a bunch of gear and mobs to discover and kill. This isn’t where things stop, as there are also endgame bosses that take things to the extreme. Naturally, with new mobs, gear, and an entirely new dimension, there are many amazing structures that players can discover. Further, the creators are constantly working on the mod to add newer features and fix bugs. This ensures things keep running smoothly.

19 Enigmatic Legacy

No. of Downloads: 9.6M

  • Creator: Aizistral
  • Download link: Enigmatic Legacy

Enigmatic Legacy isn’t one of those magic mods for Minecraft that add a fresh realm or a bunch of new and dangerous mobs to kill. Its strength lies in how it enables players to discover and use new items and mechanics in their vanilla journey. It adds a bunch of enchantments, dungeon loot, and even a healthy list of achievements to make the experience more rewarding. There’s even a well-defined inventory system to keep track of everything, along with a detailed guide on what this mod has to offer.

Essentially, Enigmatic Legacy is a top-tier choice for someone who wants to ease into modding Minecraft and scale into bigger things with time. They will find that it offers a wonderful experience that is brimming with not only new gear, passives, enchantments, and whatnot, but also ideas that they can run with down the line.

18 Embers Rekindled

No. of Downloads: 13.4M

  • Creator: BordListian
  • Download link: Embers Rekindled

Many Minecraft mods hone in on two or more aspects of the game, such as combat and mobs. Embers Rekindled is one of the many multi-faceted mods that players will find. It adds not only magical elements to the game but also technological ones. With this, it ensures that players always have something to look forward to, whether it’s diving into the magical aspects and becoming sorcerers or becoming a technical whiz and creating massive machines.

Naturally, Embers Rekindled also focuses on alchemy and how things work with each other. The systems put in place are well-detailed and intricate, allowing players to easily immerse themselves in transforming the world. Getting started can be a bit overwhelming, but this Minecraft magic mod does come with a thorough codex to help players understand what’s going on.

17 Witchery

No. of Downloads: 15.5M

  • Creator: _ForgeUser11995118
  • Download link: Witchery

Witchery is a wonderful Minecraft magic mod that has been around for about a decade. It’s not as big and flashy as some of the others on this list, but the experience it provides is unparalleled. Players have access to standard spells and magic, yes, but there’s so much more too.

Witchery focuses on what many fans call true magic. Growing special plants, brewing potions, conducting dark rituals and necromancy, and shaping the world the way they want—these are but a few things that players can do with this Minecraft magic mod. To make the experience more immersive, there are also plenty of new mobs, ancient evil bosses, and familiars present, and players can even form covens to boost their power.

Creator Emoniph’s last update was in 2015 for Minecraft Version 1.7.10. An updated experience is available via Witchery: Resurrected , a faithful fan remake, but the project is under development.

16 Iron’s Spells n’ Spellbooks

No. of Downloads: 16.7M

  • Creator: Iron431
  • Download link: Iron’s Spells n’ Spellbooks

Iron’s Spells n’ Spellbooks is quite an expansive magic mod for Minecraft . It brings the classic RPG magic fantasy offerings to the game, enabling players to cast spells, upgrade armor and weapons to new heights, add powers to them, discover and raid dungeons, fight new mobs and bosses, and a whole lot more.

Naturally, Iron’s Spells n’ Spellbooks adds new types of randomly generated structures, revamping the player experience. Essentially, it can easily be the go-to mod to add elements of the best multiplayer RPGs of all time into this sandbox title. This Minecraft magic mod currently brings in 80+ spells that help gamers range in type and power. Not only does the range add a lot of freshness to fights and general gameplay, but it also helps enliven the lore and progression that players will likely come up with.

15 Hexeri

No. of Downloads: 18.8M

  • Creator: JoeFoxe
  • Download link: Hexeri

A must-have magic mod for Minecraft , Hexeri focuses on witchcraft to an unparalleled extent. It adds a new biome, Willow Swamp, where most of the mod’s offerings are concentrated. There are new Witch Huts as well as a colony where, naturally, witches spawn. The addition of new plants and herbs for “potionmaking” as well as environmental effects shows the developers’ passion for the project. A great example is drying and burning sage to imbue an area with the Peaceful status effect.

Aside from that, a Mixing Cauldron can be created that helps create many new items. To add to its creation power, the swirling animation effect and even that of the candle dripper being used show a great level of work that has gone on in this mod.

14 Eidolon

No. of Downloads: 19.6M

  • Creator: elucent_
  • Download link: Eidolon

The list of the best magic mods in Minecraft is exhaustive, yes, but Eidolon easily takes a spot. It allows players to tread on the path of a powerful dark mage and beautifully brings together elements of sorcery, theurgy, alchemy, and much more. There are various rituals that they can partake in, gaining status effects that are beneficial in a multitude of ways. There's even one that transitions the day into night.

Along with this, players can obtain and craft a bunch of magical items to use by themselves or as an ingredient for another tool's construction. For example, the Basic Amulet necklace adds +1 Armor Toughness, while the Resolute Belt adds +1 Knockback Resistance (great when paired with the best enchantments for swords in Minecraft ).

There is a series of new blocks like the Artificer and the Workbench, and even mobs like the Wraith and the Zombie Brute. And for fans who are concerned about information dumping, there's no worry. Creator elucent_ has added a very helpful guide, the very first item to get really, that guides players through everything that this Minecraft magic mod offers.

Eidolon's last update was in January 2021 for Minecraft Version 1.16.5.

13 Roots

No. of Downloads: 25M

  • Creator: Noobanidus
  • Download link: Roots

Roots is a Minecraft magic mod that's all about nature. This is a must-have for any fan who wants to feel closer to nature and the environment but in a virtual way. It aptly adds an NPC named Druid, which, by itself, can enlighten fans about what this mod is all about. There are various kinds of enchanted armor with revamped textures, weapons like knives, magical soils that empower plants in different ways, new mobs and characters, and so, so much more.

Many fans who want to feel more in tune with nature may also want to avoid killing anything, whether a tameable Minecraft mob or not. Fortunately, by stellar game design, this magic mod allows players to farm drops from mobs without killing them. This plays a lot along the lines of powerful Druidic magic that's in harmony with nature, while also ensuring that players aren't blocked from making progress. Aesthetic and gameplay-wise, Roots is easily one of the top magic mods for Minecraft . And this doesn't even include the sheer amount of beautifully designed elements and functionality that it brings.

Roots was updated in March 2024 for game version 1.12.2.

12 Mahou Tsukai

No. of Downloads: 28.6M

  • Creator: stepcros
  • Download link: Mahou Tsukai

Mahou Tsukai is a wonderful combat-oriented magic mod for Minecraft . There are non-combat things players can do, yes, but it's unlikely that they won't spend most of their time with it in PvP battles. What makes Mahou Tsukai a must-have mod is that it gives fans the option to choose from a bunch of different types of spells, whether they raise intelligence, cause more offensive damage, offer teleportation mechanics, or even raise the earth for protection. Essentially, there's a lot that players can do with it.

This Minecraft magic mod also has an interesting mana-regeneration mechanic. Mana has its own recovery rate, which does speed up when players sleep. In case they have excess, they can also store mana to be used later. What they may find especially interesting is that they have to draw Blood Circles for the magic, and they can even use a cloth with some to make a scroll and make these magic-enabling circles portable. Overall, there are an exhaustive number of spells available for players to use, and the visual design, mechanics, and optimization are absolutely stellar.

11 Nature's Aura

No. of Downloads: 30.5M

  • Creator: Ellpeck
  • Download link: Nature's Aura

Nature's Aura focuses on harvesting, using, and replenishing something called an "Aura." It is found in the world of Minecraft and used to craft various machines and activate unique gameplay mechanics. While the mod might not look the most magical on the surface, once players have the basics set up this might be the most classic representation of creation magic in Minecraft .

The mod will require Patchouli as an additional mod, as it provides the basis for the progression system, but beyond this players are free to customize additions as they would like. Despite being a magic mod, it will also give players a ton of quality-of-life upgrades to make the day-to-day playing and progressing through the game much easier.

10 Occultism

No. of Downloads: 30.9M

  • Creator: kli_kli
  • Download link: Occultism

Occultism is a mod inspired by a series of four books by Jonathan Stroud with Djinn Bartimaeus as the protagonist. In line with the books, this magic mod for Minecraft allows players to summon spirits whenever they want. They can make these demons carry out their bidding, create powerful weapons and items, collect resources, and much more.

Any new expansive mod can feel like a lot when starting out. To ease players into the world, the creators have developed the Dictionary of Spirits that not only gets them started, but also helps them navigate through all the features present.

9 Ensorcellation

No. of Downloads: 34.5M

  • Creator: TeamCoFH
  • Download link: Ensorcellation

Unlike other Minecraft mods that try to do a little bit of everything, Ensorcellation does one thing, and it does it very well indeed. It adds a ton of new enchantments into the game, for armor and weapons, as well as making them compatible with all item types and significantly improving the enchantments offered in vanilla Minecraft.

These enchantments will suit almost any need, offering quality-of-life improvements, combat stats, and much more, making it perfect to use alongside other mods or as a standalone to improve the experience for any player.

8 Forbidden and Arcanus

No. of Downloads: 39.1M

  • Creator: cesar_zorak
  • Download link: Forbidden and Arcanus

Forbidden and Arcanus is one of the most popular magic mods for Minecraft . One of the factors that make it a great choice to opt for is how the creators are constantly patching bugs and adding new features, with content like new pets, bosses, wands, staves, and much more in store for the future.

One of the biggest draws is how players can create and upgrade their Hephaestus Forge. This namesake to the Olympian god allows players to modify their weapons with features like eternal durability, a magnetized modifier on boots that increases a player’s pick-up range, etc.

7 Runelic

No. of Downloads: 52.8M

  • Creator: DarkhaxDev
  • Download link: Runelic

A magic mod might not be the perfect description for Runelic, but it does add a nice little spark to any world. It's a small mod with only one real function, and that is to give players the ability to translate any in-game text into the Minecraft rune font that most players will be familiar with from enchanting tables.

This may sound like a nightmare, but for veteran players who can translate, or anyone keen to add a touch of something extra to Minecraft's open world, this ability to translate the text can be the icing on the cake.

6 Thaumcraft

No. of Downloads: 57.6M

  • Creator: Azanor13
  • Download link: Thaumcraft

Thaumcraft is perhaps the most traditional representation of magic available for Minecraft , as the first thing any player will be required to do is craft a wand. This is not to say that the mod is all about casting spells, however, as players will find themselves exploring, gathering, and performing miracles using the essence found in everyday objects.

Most players who have dabbled in magic in Minecraft will be very familiar with Thaumcraft. It offers an easy beginning, as well as a powerful late game. For players looking to try out their first mod of this kind—or even veteran modders wanting to spice things up — look no further.

Thaumcraft's last update was in October 2018 for Minecraft 1.12.2.

item.title: Metaphor: ReFantazio - Which Royal Virtue Should You Focus On First
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Which Royal Virtue Should You Rank Up First In Metaphor: ReFantazio
  • Royal Virtue Priority Ranking In Metaphor: ReFantazio

Much like the Persona series, Metaphor: ReFantazio has its own form of social stats known as Royal Virtues. There are five in total, Wisdom, Tolerance, Eloquence, Imagination, and Courage, all of which are important for progressing various bonds with your companions.

Each Royal Virtue will need to be maxed out in order to finish every bond, but there is still an ideal order that players can stick to in order to maximize their free time, especially on the Gauntlet Runner. While this list will focus on which Royal Virtues to focus on, it's best to keep them as even as possible once you reach the mid and late game.

Which Royal Virtue Should You Rank Up First In Metaphor: ReFantazio

It's important to know that not all Royal Virtues require the same amount of points to max out, meaning some will require less work than others. There are many activities you'll complete naturally while playing various sections of the game, so your free time on the Gauntlet Runner is always an important choice. When you first start out the game, you should focus on getting your Wisdom to rank 2 right away .

This allows you to unlock Brigitta's bond and a useful dungeon to grind at before taking on the first main boss of the game. You'll also want to start working on your Imagination and try to get it to rank 2 before reaching the second town , as another missable follower requires that rank. There are only two followers that require Royal Virtues to unlock their bond, and focusing on those Royal Virtues right away will have you ready to unlock them once you find them.

Royal Virtue Priority Ranking In Metaphor: ReFantazio

While it's important to try and keep your Royal Virtues fairly even, the following list should be the order you focus on most, with it mostly based on how much more work is required to rank up that Virtue.

  • Wisdom
  • Imagination
  • Eloquence
  • Tolerance
  • Courage

While Courage isn't the easiest Virtue to rank up, it is awarded every time you clear a bounty or a rank in the Arena , meaning you'll get lots of points for this virtue without devoting Gauntlet Runner free time to it.

There are many books you'll get as the game progresses that can be read while the Gauntlet Runner is moving, and those should all be read as soon as they appear no matter where their Virtue appears on the above list. Books can also be read even after they are finished, giving you ways of increasing any Virtue while the Gauntlet Runner is moving no matter what party members are available.
